questions.question: It is time you ………………………… that mole checked.
questions.description: A simple past is used after it is time to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: There …………………………… be a tea stall in that corner.
questions.description: Used to can be used to talk about past states. Would cannot be used with this meaning.

questions.question: He …………………………… to be a singer.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about needs, wants, desires, aspirations etc.

questions.question: If she left home at six, she ……………………………… be here soon.
There are no secrets between you and …………………………….
questions.description: Between is a preposition. A pronoun used after the preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: She patted ………………………… on the back for completing the project on time.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, the reflexive pronoun (herself, yourself etc.) is used instead of the object pronoun.

questions.question: I waited ………………………… hours and then I went home.
………………………………. playing to the best of our ability, we could not win the match.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of can be used here.

questions.question: They congratulated her …………………………………. her success.
questions.description: Either for or on is possible here.

questions.question: Why are you always shouting ………………………….. me?
…………………………….. of them was there.
questions.description: All and some should be followed by a plural verb.
